availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James P. McCallum (Louisville, Kentucky, brick mason)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, brick mason. Native of Ireland. Son of James P. McCallum. Married to Mary A. Connor McCallum in Jefferson County, Kentucky, on August 4, 1853. Father of Solomon McCallum, James McCallum, John McCallum, Mary McCallum, William McCallum, and Samuel McCallum. Brickmaker in Louisville in 1850. Household owned twenty-nine enslaved persons in Louisville in 1850. Master brick maker in Louisville in 1860. Hired fifteen enslaved persons in Louisville in 1860. Brick mason in Louisville in 1864. Employed Isaac Welch as a laborer in Louisville in 1860. Brickyard proprietor in Louisville in 1865.
